[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Information System (IS) defines requirements for managing personnel records, assignments, and compliance monitoring across agencies.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: IS supports personnel tracking, role assignments, agency performance evaluation, and compliance enforcement.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: IS integrates with agency databases for personnel records, compliance tracking, and reporting.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: IS provides web-based portals for agency staff, auditors, and administrators.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: IS supports desktop terminals, mobile devices, and biometric authentication kiosks.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: IS uses PostgreSQL for structured storage  REST APIs for data exchange  reporting  and personnel tracking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: IS secures data transmission via TLS encryption and multi-factor authentication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: IS optimizes storage for large personnel records and real-time updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: IS manages personnel assignments  compliance audits  and performance analysis.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: IS is configurable for various agency structures and operational policies.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: IS connects with compliance monitoring  fraud detection  and regulatory reporting systems.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: IS manages personnel records  assignments  compliance tracking  and agency performance evaluation.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for agency staff  auditors  and administrators overseeing personnel records and compliance.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: IS requires network connectivity for real-time personnel updates and compliance reporting.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: IS relies on secure authentication  accurate personnel data  and regulatory frameworks.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Regional Directorate: Administrative body overseeing multiple agencies for compliance and operational efficiency.
Personnel Tracking: System functionality for monitoring personnel records, roles, and assignments.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with agency databases to maintain personnel tracking and role assignments.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall provide compliance and performance reports for regulatory oversight.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall manage personnel assignments, employment history, and compliance status (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall track personnel movements, including transfers and promotions (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall generate reports on workload distribution, performance trends, and compliance violations (REQ-DB-003).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an interactive dashboard for personnel tracking and compliance monitoring.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process personnel updates without significant delay.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store personnel assignments, compliance records, and role histories.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall track employment status, training logs, and career progression.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-003: The system shall store agency-wide performance evaluations and compliance reports.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall enforce encryption, authentication, and access control policies.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with data protection laws and regulatory security policies.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log personnel updates, compliance checks, and access history for auditing.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests tracking, role assignments, audits, and compliance.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, and compliance manuals.
[SEC] 5. References: Personnel regulations, compliance policies, and security standards.
